title: Which one is better, a lot of certificates or a university degree? - Quora

response.answer_text: Imagine, after spending years of education and financial resources on the education you end up working at a place you have always refused to be a part of. Not getting the work of your own choice and held responsible for performing the tasks you never wanted to do. It is quite understood that none of us will desire to work in an environment contrary to our skills and interests. We all try to figure out the skills we possess in any of the fields in the early days of our qualifications. This can be the finance, accounting, marketing, sales, management, IT, computer science, engineering, health and safety, etc. These fields are pursued only after getting the recognized certifications and professional degrees from various institutes in any of the field of your own choice. The decision of selecting the certification or a degree is based on the outline of the course you are interested in studying. Some of the fields consist of better scope in a certain region, whereas others are preferred in different areas. The candidate has to analyze the demand, the nature of work, career and scope of the field he is willing to pursue. There are degrees, certifications and diplomas offered in almost all the fields of varying duration. The duration of the degrees and certifications depend on the depth of the field you are willing to study and the course outlines. In this article we will discuss the pros and cons of selecting degrees and certifications. The few main points to consider while choosing a certification or a degree are: 1. Cost and Time: One major drawback for obtaining a degree is that it consumes a lot more time than getting certified. Degrees mostly consist of the time period of 4 years. The number of courses needed to be completed in a degree usually is 42-48 in number. Although degrees are provided under the supervision of qualified professors who have spent years of their career in learning and practicing in their respective fields but certifications are comparatively more learning based in terms of trainings and examination. Certification is a right choice for your career if you have a little time for the completion of your studies and soon want to start their practical careers. Degrees cost 2-3 times higher than that of certifications, which provides an opportunity to the candidates for saving money and investing it later in their careers. 2. Work Experience: Can you get a relevant industry experience while pursuing a full time degree? The hectic 6-8 regular school hours rarely allow any student to get the practical industry experience for polishing their skills and improvisations of their understanding with the qualification and theories they learn during their professional degrees. Having a certification often makes your resume stand out and gives you an advantage over other applicants in the hiring process. Certified professionals have an association with the current competencies, trends and technologies introduced in the market. Whereas degrees might not change their curriculum as often as the certifications does. You may have spent the time and money for the degree but your field job might only prefer an industry certification. Evaluate the market before selecting any! 3. Nature of Job: You need to know very well the requirements of the job first. If the nature of work is highly technical and requires you to have an understanding with the latest innovations in the field, you might better select certification for yourself In the interested field. If the job is more related to business activities, decisions and have management aspects involved in it, the professional degree will work better for you. 4. Geographical Analysis: Sometimes, the career decisions are highly influenced by the geographical demand and situations within a country or a region. You have to survey, ask and analyze the preferences of the organization while hiring the candidates. They might prefer a certified individual or a professional degree holder depending on the nature of work. 5. Advance your Career: Whether you acquire a certification or a degree, it Is significant for you to keep yourself updated with the help of several certifications offered on a timely basis for the latest technology trends across the globe in the field you are associated with, staying up to date on your certifications may mean the difference between career stagnation and career advancement. 6. Higher Wage and Positions: If you want to be an early age millionaire than in no way you are supposed to go for a degree. It takes a few years for the professional degree candidate to get started with the handsome amount of money to earn. Certified professional get a higher range of start in terms of salary as there is no need for them to earn a separate industry experience. Certified professionals are considered to be more productive and efficient in terms of dealing with the tough challenges at work places. If you are gaining a degree then it’s better for you to ask permission for the work experience from your institute. In this way, you might get a better start in terms of salary. 7. Relevancy: One of the lifetime advantages of getting the degree is that it doesn’t require any renewal or reissuance just like the certification. The majority certifications get expired after a limited time period which gets difficult for the candidate to renew it, earning a certification on a new product or emerging technology can make you the subject matter expert in your organization and make you stand out for your early efforts.
Certifications, though those pale in comparison to experience. Companies routinely waive degree and certification requirements for the right candidate. Experience is something you just can’t fake.
